column5: I have to rebuild my transom and have already picked up a sheet of marine plywaood at $135.00  , and I would like feedback on experiences/recommendations with marine glue to laminate it together.  Any input is most welcome.  Matt
Fiberglass resin Matt. You can't get any better than that.   Cheers, Ron...

What Wayne said, I didn't think that stuff was around anymore.  I built my own set of oars a long time ago from clear cedar with oak inserts all laminated together with the stuff in the blue and green can.  Never comes undone.
You can get it from Noah's as well.. I just found it there at $3 less a can and they state $9 postage anywhere in Canada.
I should pick up a can just for those days when I may get into building something that needs good waterproof glue.  Thanks
http://www.deerso.com/PT_RESORCINOL_GLUE334294-details.aspx?src=gbs  I completely rebuild the dual drivers seat of my SeaRay cruiser years ago using this and stainless wood screws.
